Context: The Deaf Learn Now program is run by George Brown College and funded by Employment Ontario. It is open to Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing adults age 19 or older who live in Ontario. The program is tuition-free for Ontario residents. Students can start the program at any time and work at their own pace. Some courses may only take a few days, while others may take several weeks. The program offers visual courses and has staff who can communicate through ASL (American Sign Language) and English. Interested individuals can register on the Deaf Learn Now website and arrange for a 1-1 video meeting to discuss learning goals and create a learning plan. The contact information for George Brown College is 416-415-2000 and TTY: 1-877-515-5559, and the email address is ask.george@georgebrown.ca. The website contains information that may be subject to change without notice.
